ygData.subject: Re: New Topic, Languages!!!
ygData.msgSnippet: Hmmm, Now that I think about it, my skills in language are equl to my compatriots skills. I think you may have something on that one.... -Dyce
ygData.messageBody:
Hmmm,

Now that I think about it, my skills in language are equl to my
compatriots skills. I think you may have something on that one....

-Dyce

> -----Original Message-----
> From: Aalek Ironback [SMTP:aalekironback@...]
> Sent: Wednesday, May 05, 1999 3:44 AM
> To: eqpaladin@onelist.com
> Subject: [eqpaladin] Re: New Topic, Languages!!!
>
> From: "Aalek Ironback" <aalekironback@...>
>
> I may be wrong due to lack of patience, but it seemed to me that a person
> learning a language from your spamming can only learn up to your current
> skill level in that language. I was able to learn elvish to excellent
> level, from an elf, in one boat crossing from freeport to Butcherblock,
> but
> when a friend and I tried to increase our feeble skills in gnomish and
> Tier'Dal, we were unable to learn beyond our respective skill levels after
> a
> considerably longer period of time.
> Somebody tell me if they've experienced otherwise.
>
> Aalek
> Paladin of the 15th Rank
>
>
> ------------------------------------------------------------------------
> Who offers the richest group communications tools on the Internet?
> http://www.onelist.com
> Answer: ONElist. Check out our homepage for details!
